metadata.feature_description: Manages file versions with configurable maximum versions per portal and version-specific operations

steps.expected: Assets panel opens with folder listing
steps.actual: Assets panel opened successfully showing Images folder

steps.action: Hover over file and click edit button to open file details
steps.expected: File details panel opens with Details and Versioning tabs
steps.actual: File details panel opened for CTA-1.jpg with both Details and Versioning tabs visible

steps.expected: Version history table is displayed with version information
steps.actual: Versioning tab displayed showing Maximum number of versions: 5, and Version 1 details including Date (2/9/2026 3:03:27 PM), User (SuperUser Account), State (Published), and Preview button

steps.action: Click Preview button in version history table
steps.expected: Specific version of file is downloaded
steps.actual: File 'CTA-1.v1.jpg' was downloaded successfully, demonstrating version-specific download functionality

steps.action: Navigate to Home folder and hover over a folder
steps.expected: Folder action buttons appear (edit, move, delete)
steps.actual: Action buttons appeared when hovering over Images folder showing edit (pencil), move (arrow), and delete (trash) icons

steps.action: Click edit button on Badges folder to open folder settings
steps.expected: Folder details panel opens with Details and Permissions tabs, showing Versioning toggle
steps.actual: Folder details panel opened showing Created date, Last Modified date, Folder type (Standard), Name field, Workflow dropdown, and Versioning toggle (currently Off)

steps.expected: Versioning toggle changes to On state
steps.actual: Versioning toggle successfully changed to On (blue/active state)

steps.action: Click Save to apply versioning settings
steps.expected: Settings are saved and panel closes
steps.actual: Versioning settings saved successfully, folder details panel closed

steps.action: Navigate into the versioned Badges folder
steps.actual: Badges folder contents displayed showing badge image files

steps.action: Open file details for a file in versioned folder and view Versioning tab
steps.expected: Version history displays version metadata including version number, date, user, and state
steps.actual: Versioning tab displayed complete metadata: Maximum number of versions: 5, Version 1 with Date (2/9/2026 3:04:30 PM), User (SuperUser Account), State (Published), and Preview button

steps.action: View version history for multiple files
steps.expected: Maximum number of versions limit is displayed
steps.actual: Maximum number of versions: 5 is displayed consistently in the Versioning tab for files, indicating portal-level configuration

steps.action: Access file versioning features as SuperUser/Administrator
steps.expected: Full access to version history, download, and folder versioning settings
steps.actual: SuperUser Account has full access to view version history, download specific versions via Preview button, and configure folder versioning settings (enable/disable versioning toggle)

observations: The Versioning tab in file details shows comprehensive version information: version number, date, user, state, and Preview (download) functionality
Maximum number of versions is configured at 5 per portal and is displayed in the Versioning tab header
Folder-level versioning can be enabled/disabled via a toggle in folder settings under the Details tab
The Preview button in the version table downloads the specific version with a filename format of 'filename.v{version_number}.extension' (e.g., CTA-1.v1.jpg)
Code suggests additional version operations exist (restore, delete version, rollback) via IFileVersionController interface, but these were not visible in the current UI for published versions
The create new version functionality requires file upload with overwrite, which would create additional versions up to the maximum limit

Compare versions feature mentioned in the prompt was not found in the current UI - code review shows IFileVersionController has methods like GetVersionContent that could support comparison, but no UI element was identified
